definition: lit. the horse loses its front hooves/fig. sudden failure through miscalculation or inattentiveness
horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]
to lose/to miss/to fail
front/forward/ahead/first/top (followed by a number)/future/ago/before/BC (e.g. 前293年)/former/formerly
hoof/pig's trotters
variant of 蹄[ti2]

sentences.english: Every service team stumps their toe from time to time.
sentences.chinese: 每个服务团队都会有马失前蹄的时候。

sentences.english: She acknowledged that error and said that "he had to do a year over" to cover.
sentences.chinese: 她知道马失前蹄了，辩称“他确实需要念多一年书”。

definition: to meet with unexpected failure (idiom)/to fail miserably (where failure was not expected)
to lose Jingzhou due to carelessness (idiom)/to suffer a major setback due to negligence
to fall head over heels/(fig.) to come a cropper
to fail within sight of success (idiom); last-minute failure/to fall at the last hurdle/snatching defeat from the jaws of victory
to fall/fig. to suffer a setback
one's bicycle chain comes off/(fig.) to let sb down/to drop the ball/to screw up
to capsize/(fig.) to suffer a setback or defeat
a slip/miscalculation/unwise move/accidentally/by mistake/to lose control/to be defeated
see 一著不慎，滿盤皆輸|一着不慎，满盘皆输[yi1 zhao1 bu4 shen4 , man3 pan2 jie1 shu1]
lit. to ruin the enterprise for the sake of one basketful/to fail through lack of a final effort/to spoil the ship for a ha'penny worth of tar (idiom)
extreme joy turns to sorrow (idiom); Don't celebrate too soon, things could still go wrong!
Waterloo (Belgium)/Battle of Waterloo (1815)/fig. a defeat/failure
failed and wiped over the floor (idiom); to fail utterly/a crushing defeat/beaten and in a hopeless position
so pleased as to lose one's sense of measure/beside oneself with joy
(literary) to be routed (in a war)/to suffer defeat (in sports etc)
to underestimate the enemy
